That made me smile. "I knew we'd find all our answers in the library," I said to my friends. The Beast agreed and apologized for doubting my abilities, and then ... he thanked me! I went to bed that night feeling very proud - and very tired. Just as I was about to blow out my candle, I heard a light tap on my door. It was Chip. "Hello," I said, surprised. "Why aren't you in bed?" Chip explained that he couldn't sleep, and wondered if there was a book that might help him. I smiled and told him that I was certain we could find just such a book. We went back to the library, and I chose a storybook. Then I settled into a comfy chair with Chip in my lap. I opened the cover and began to read softly. "Once upon a time, in a faraway land . . ." Soon, Chip's eyelids were drooping. I quietly closed the book and carried him back to the cupboard. I'd been right. There was nothing a book - and a friend - couldn't fix. The end.
I've so enjoyed spending time with you today. I hope that you'll visit again very soon. Goodbye.
